ac:rich-text-body.p: This is the index page for the Software Architecture Documentation with the english version of the arc42 standard as a template.
arc42 supports software- and system architects. It is based upon practical experience of many architecture projects of different sizes and domains. It includes feedback of its many users.
arc42 contains a template for development, documentation and communication of software architectures.
arc42 fits arbitrary technologies and tools.
arc42 therefore ensures better software- and system architectures.

The easiest way for browsing this space is to turn on the sidebar of confluence. You will find the button for it on the lefthand side at the bottom corner of your browser, portrayed as two arrows. Click on it - and the sidebar will show up.
The sidebar works like any browser tree structure. It shows all the 12 chapters of the ARC42 Template. Click on the arrow to see the subchapters or hide them again.

1. Introduction and Goals
problem, brief definition of task, quality goals, summary of architecturally relevant requirements, especially the non-functional reqs, list of stakeholder.

2. Constraints
What kind of constraints restrict design decisions?

3. Context
What's the business and technical context of the system?

4. Solution Ideas and Strategy
How does the solution work? What are the fundamental solution approaches?

5. Building Block View
Static structure of system, implementation Blocks.

6. Runtime View
Cooperation of (instances) of building blocks at runtime, relevant and important interactions.

7. Deployment View
Deployment: On which hardware will the building blocks be operated? What further information is required to operate the system?

8. Concepts
Recurring patterns and structures.
Business domain models.
Crosscutting (technical) concepts.
These concepts can often be re-used across systems.

10. Quality Scenarios
Quality tree with scenarios.
